docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Ill., Dec. 25 -- The way Santa Claus treated Mascagni was "something scand lous." There being no Italian saint of that sort, the Anglo-Saxon gift giver ought to have been generous, but the best he could do for the composer was to hand him a package marked "More Trouble."

headline.main: MASCAGNI'S SAD CHRISTMAS.; His Presents Consisted of More Troubles -- Remained in His Room All Day.
